com.safety4kids.game.Screens

Class GameScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.safety4kids.game.Screens.GameScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Level1Screen, Level2Screen, Level3Screen

    public abstract class GameScreen
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
    This Class represents the states that both level 1 and 3 inherit from. This includes the base game functionality like the gameCam, the sprite batches, the viewPorts and the Box2d World
    Author:
    Erfan Yeganehfar, Bill Bai Ms. Krasteva Modifications: 3.1 Erfan Yeg: (2019-05-31) Created this Class for ease of use/ reasuability in the levels. -- 30mins 3.2 Erfan Yeg: (2019-05-2) Added states to the levels, allowing the user to exit to the main menu -- 15mins 4.0 Added states variables enabling pause options, also added some get methods

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameScreen

        public GameScreen()
        The constructor of the GameScreen, creates all the base necessary components of the platformer. Which is the actual game, the sprite batches, game camera, viewport, and a Box2d world and contact listeners

      • update

        public abstract void update(float dt)
        each render tick has an update execution to change the game application based on inputs and events
        Parameters:
        dt - The target frame rate minus the time taken to complete this frame is called the delta time, used to keep the frames consistant across platforms

      • render

        public abstract void render(float delta)
        Rendering allows the game to be drawn to the screen while still updating the game, basically a dynamic drawing method

        Parameters:
